Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in determining that the applicants were not Convention refugees or persons in need of protection
Procedural_Context: Judicial review following initial denial of refugee claim
Evidence_Type: Ethnically-motivated violence, racial slurs, ongoing ethnic tensions, evidence of discrimination
Legal_Provision: Section 97 and Section 98 of IRPA â€“ Convention refugee and person in need of protection
Basis_of_Claim: Race, nationality, membership in a particular social group
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Mixed motives (economic vs. racial) in incidents of violence
Application_Error: Failure to consider mixed motives including racial element
Review_Outcome: Case remanded for re-determination by a different Board member
Evidence_Ignored: Evidence of racial slurs and ethnic tensions suggesting racially motivated persecution
Legal_Standard: Persecution based on protected grounds under the Refugee Convention
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board (IRB), Federal Court of Canada
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Article 1A(2) of the Refugee Convention, Section 96 and 97 of IRPA
Cause_of_Refusal: Board characterized violence as economically motivated rather than racially motivated
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to assess credibility and relevance of evidence regarding racial motivation
Procedural_Fairness: Board failed to provide adequate reasons addressing all relevant factors
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claimants challenged the Board's narrow interpretation of motive
Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada, with reference to international refugee law
Omission_Type: Failure to consider mixed motives in assessing persecution
